greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of subsets of {1..n} whose product is one more than the sum of their complement.
comment: Also by definition the number of subsets whose sum is one fewer than the product of their complement.
link: Giovanni Resta, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2500
example: The initial terms count the following subsets:
mathematica: ric[n_, pr_, s_, lst_, t_] := Block[{k}, If[pr == t-s, cnt++]; Do[ If[pr k <= t, ric[n, pr k, s + k, k, t], Break[]], {k, lst+1, n}]]; a[n_] := (cnt = 0; ric[n, 1, 0, 0, n (n + 1)/2 + 1]; cnt); a /@ Range[0, 85] (* _Giovanni Resta_, Sep 13 2019 *)
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jul 07 2019
ext: More terms from _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 12 2019
